It is wonderful that teachers in other states that can get the vaccine. 
The anxiety and stress that I feel for each teacher vaccine post I see is overwhelming. 
Teachers in NC were bumped behind 65+. We cannot get it. But many of us are teaching in person. 

This is not OK.

text: Please excuse me if this is inelegantly put, but the idea that math academia (or academia as a whole) is a pure meritocracy is just silly. If you think it's easy to be, say, a person of color, or trans, in our field, you're not paying attention.

text:
Working on an apportionment project. Tried to check the 1792 numbers. Pulled the census data. Read the law (passed 4/13/1792). Numbers weren't working out.

I was counting enslaved people as, you know, full people, not 3/5ths. Devastated.

Math is not neutral. Never has been.

1) Do now (5 min)

3) Guided practice (20 min)
 
4) exit ticket (10 min)
 
#mtbos

Ok, twitter. Need your help. I'm looking for a job. I want to find the "right fit." When you visit schools, what questions do you ask? How do you get past the brochure presentation to the substance? WHO do you talk to?

text:
Reading a publication from a Maths organization this morning &naming the ways white educators centre their experiences as the only way to experience maths, their limited thoughts as the only instructional approaches, and the ease with which they rebuff calls to action.

text:
Usually when kids don't know the sign for 1,000 they sign 1 followed by indiscriminate 0s. Or 100-0. Or 10-0-0. 

The sign for 100 is a 1 handshape and then a C handshape. 

Today I asked a kid what the number after 999 is and he said "1 , looooongC" and I think that's great.
